basics.name: Murali Ramu
basics.label: Senior Applications Engineer
basics.summary: I'm an applications engineer holding a master's in integrated circuits and systems and a bachelor's in electronics and communication engineering. I've primarily worked as a Customer Applications Engineer with experience in supporting Wi-Fi equipment from the Infineon/Cypress line-up. I'm eager to investigate fresh opportunities and responsibilities in design, applications, and firmware development. I'm willing to engage in discussions and consider positions that might not fit into the few categories I've listed.

projects.name: SoC : Planning and Prototyping
projects.summary: I implemented a PoC for performance optimization using timing driven placements on SoC PnP. This involved generating a Liberty file using TCL by quering internal data and later running timing driven placements on OpenRoad.

projects.name: Clock and data recovery circuits
projects.summary: Designed linear and bang-bang clock and data recovery circuits with forwarded as well as not forwarded clock for data running at around 5Gbps in LtSpice as part of a course, VLSI and Broadband Communication Circuits.

projects.name: 8*8 Signed Multiplier
projects.summary: Designed both schematic and layout of an 8*8 signed multiplier using CMOS full adders in Electric, did critical path analysis and increased the clock speed through pipelining as part of a course, Digital IC Design.

projects.name: Hobby projects
projects.summary: Home automations, wireless communication(WIFI, BT, RF, DTMF), multiple types of robots, drowsiness detection using brainwaves.

work.name: Infineon technologies
highlights: I am responsible for helping customers get their wifi radios ready before they go into regulatory testing.
I also do schematic reviews and help customers with a few hardware queries.
I also look at WLAN firmware issues.

work.summary: I started supporting Cypress' Wi-Fi customers in my first job out of college. This gave me exposure to how customers work, introduced me to product design cycles.
work.name: Cypress Semiconductor
highlights: I extensively worked on the company's embeddedInfineon's Wi-Fi portfolio and I worked on WICED and ModusToolBox when I was exposed to a few technologies like ThreadX, FreeRTOS, LwIP, NetX, Makefiles.
I also worked on developing projects showcasing Infineon's products and developed a few Code Examples.
I also worked on automating  regulatory flow which reduced the turn around time from a few weeks to a few hours.
